item.title: Johnny Hates Jazz - Shattered Dreams - Baritone Ukulele
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for DGBE Ukulele.
Chords used: Em, Bm, C, Am, D, A, Fm, Eb, Bb, C#, Bbm
As performed by Johnny Hates Jazz
Tutorial Video (GCEA & DGBE): https://youtu.be/pdSr1ZjAWuE
Chord chart ("Tabs") available at: https://ukutabs.com/j/johnny-hates-jazz/shattered-dreams/
************************************************
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. Motion video background from https://www.motionbolt.com
Check out the UkeStuff Podcast, where I talk about ukulele education and my own ukulele experiences. Available on Radio Public, Apple Podcasts, Google Play, Spotify, and Stitcher. If you don't have a podcast app, please check out Radio Public for all your podcasts--they support podcasters financially.
You are invited to visit my ukulele blog/website, ukestuff.info (a free resource). Also on social media: Twitter (@UkeStuff) and Instagram (@ukestuff.info).
Want to make a donation towards this work? Visit https://www.buymeacoffee.com/ukestuff
Are you a teacher using ukulele in the classroom? Check out my video based method...effective, easy, and inexpensive! https://ukestuff.wordpress.com/the-video-ukulele-method/
Check out the "merch": https://teespring.com/stores/ukestuff
Thanks for watching the videos and supporting the channel! Your support of these videos and subscription to the channel makes it possible to produce this content.

item.title: Jason Mraz - I Won't Give Up - Key of D
item.description:
Ukulele play along
I Won't Give Up - Jason Mraz
Using the chords: A Bm7 C C# D Em G
Suggested Strum Patterns: D DU DU or D DU U (or a combination of both)
Notes: The audio has been slightly lowered (1 tone) to make it more suitable for the ukulele
This video is meant for educational purposes.
No copyright infringement intended

item.title: Memory from "Cats" - Ukulele Play Along - Key of A, C
item.description:
For educational use.
Chords Used: A, F-sharp minor, D, C-sharp minor, Bm, E, F#, B, F, Dm, Bb, Am, G, C, Em (Starts in the key of A, ends in the key of C).
Memory from the musical “Cats” by Andrew Lloyd Webber. It’s been lowered by 1 semitone so beginner ukulele students can play along. I just added chords to the lyric video created by YouTuber Miyanoe.
Do you have a request for a song to be made into a video? First, check the index of play alongs at www.ukeplayalongs.com to make sure your song isn't already available. If it isn't, please fill out this request form: https://forms.gle/84rgm7kFNJWnTqFB6 . We cannot promise that a request will be made into a play along, but we do appreciate your recommendations!
If you found this video useful please subscribe and share with your friends. If you want to be notified of future videos please click on bell next to subscribe.

item.title: Josh Groban - Believe - Key of D
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of D. Lowered from the original key of E.
As performed by Josh Groban.
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com.
Check out the Ukulele Video Play Along Podcast, where I talk about ukulele education and my own ukulele experiences. Available on Apple Podcasts and Google Play.
Are these ukulele resources valuable to you? If so, consider following my blog at ukestuff.info, and becoming a patron at www.patreon.com/cjrphd. There is a master list of all similar play along videos at ukestuff.info.

item.title: Gilligan’s Island Ukulele Play Along (TV Show Video background) - Key of Dm
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele.
Here’s a lesson on barre chords, using the theme to Gilligan’s Island. A lot of people may not know this show, but as I grew up, this show was one of the shows in syndication—and I watched it every afternoon. Here’s a great way to learn some barre chords (only two shapes, the “Am” and the “A” shapes). The second half of the song (ending credits) moves quite a bit faster. Don’t forget that you can use YouTube’s tools to slow down a video and retain the pitch.
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com.
Check out the Ukulele Video Play Along Podcast, where I talk about ukulele education and my own ukulele experiences. Available on Apple Podcasts and Google Play.
Are these ukulele resources valuable to you? If so, consider following my blog at ukestuff.info, and becoming a patron at www.patreon.com/cjrphd. There is a master list of all similar play along videos at ukestuff.info.
